title: Safer Juice - Part 5 - Agriculture Practices and Raw Materials

tasks.task: Ensure safety and quality of raw materials for juice production
subtasks: Identify sources of raw materials (fruit, vegetables, water, additives)
Manage soil and water quality
Sanitize field and packing facilities
Monitor and control pest infestations
Ensure proper use and handling of agricultural chemicals
Train workers on hygiene and sanitation practices
Implement Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP)
Document and track product traceability and documentation for liability and problem resolution

tasks.task: Minimize microbial contamination in raw materials
subtasks: Use proper irrigation and fertilization methods
Manage animal manure and biosolids
Prevent wildlife and pest access to fields
Regularly test water sources for microbial contamination
Maintain proper water quality and sanitize equipment during processing and transportation
Train workers on proper hygiene, sanitation, and hazardous condition recognition

tasks.task: Analyze and manage risks associated with microbial contamination
subtasks: Identify potential contamination sources (soil, water, manure, wildlife, equipment)
Develop preventive measures for each identified risk
Implement monitoring and corrective actions for identified risks
Utilize guidelines and resources from FDA and EPA
Establish grower agreements and worker accountability measures
Follow local, state, and federal regulations for agricultural practices

tasks.task: Protect public health through microbial food safety management
subtasks: Understand the lifecycle of produce from farm to table
Implement strategies to minimize microbial hazards at each stage (production, harvest, handling, transportation)
Continuously assess and update safety protocols based on best practices and new information
